website_summaries.verdict: A true desktop external hard drive for larger Macs focused on media and graphic design.
pros: Large hard drive capacity is compatible with the Mac backup software, Works with Time Machine without any set up
Comes with dual USB connections to extend the computer's connectivity
cons: Backing up a Mac or PC can be difficult without using the built-in software like Time Machine

customer_reviews.title: First Seagate.....Last Seagate
customer_reviews.text: Never had a problem with any external hard drive...until now. Purchased this drive because of the capacity and USB hub capability. I downloaded my content to the drive and it worked normally for about 24-hours. After 24-hours the drive became very unreliable....it would disconnect from my computer for absolutely no reason. This action troubled me so I purchased another backup drive and I've spent nearly 10 hours transferring my data off the Seagate hard drive....during this process it has shutdown more than 50 times during my attempts to transfer data. Attached picture is from when I left the hard drive unattended for an hour....the drive continually connects and disconnects without user input.
customer_reviews.author: James Mansard

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible for use with PS4 firmware 4.5.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this HDD in hopes of using this with the PS4 (firmware update 4.5 allows the use of external hard drives). Unfortunately this hard drive is not supported with the PS4. After further investigation no HUB type hard drives are supported with the PS4. The hard drive is fine and connects without issues with my desktop PC. Just wanted to warn people who were looking for an upgrade for their PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with the XBOX ONE X!
customer_reviews.text: Seagate has a few of these 8TB External Hub Drives segmented to various markets. Just wanted to let everyone know this works perfectly with the XBOX ONE X. Literally plug and play. Your XBOX will ask you if you want to use this as a media drive or format as a game drive. Once formatted you'll have about ~7.2TB available for game storage. (After over-provision: This is normal for ALL drives) So if you're looking for a matching black hub drive this will work wonders for you. The only thing missing is the fancy Xbox branding that the whitehas on the chassis.
customer_reviews.author: hyp36rmax

customer_reviews.title: very high failure rate 8TB disk from Seagate
customer_reviews.text: Am now on my SECOND drive, and about to return it. The first one failed after about 5 months; Windows could no longer find the disk, but the usb hub still works. The second one failed after about 3 weeks; windows can find the disk, but can't read it, and the usb hub still works, and the disk is still spinning. Both disks suddenly failed after power cycling. No warning, no grinding noises, no data errors, just dead! I wouldn't suggest this '8TB backup plus hub' drive to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: HaveFun

customer_reviews.title: This was cheaper than the actual 8TB HDD. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This was cheaper than the actual 8TB HDD. I ripped it open and kept the hard drive, I also kept the hub mechanisms in tact and popped in an old 1TB HDD. If you open this yourself, expect the plastic housing to be ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Everything's working great so far
customer_reviews.text: Everything's working great so far, stress tested in the original enclosure for 24 hours to ensure functionality. If you're interested to know what drive is inside; it's the 10TB BarraCuda Pro ST10000DM0004. I'm using this 10TB drive in a different enclosure as part of a larger mirror array. Very quick drive and cool running. I've "shucked" the 6TB and 8TB models as well, and both of them are the slower writing SMR type BarraCuda (non pro) drives. Even though the 6TB and 8TB were SMR they still work great for my archive array.
customer_reviews.author: L5M62MP7G8

customer_reviews.title: One of my top purchases of 2018.
customer_reviews.text: This hub is an absolute game-changer. The two USB ports on it allow for me to expand my Macbook's free USB slot into effectively 3, which I couldn't find with any other brand. Before, I would have to unplug my drive every time that I wanted to print something or check another drive, which made it a nightmare, as well as impossible to transfer files from one drive to another. This allows me to always have it plugged in, and plug all of my secondary accessories directly into it. It's also very quiet and incredibly affordable. This has been one of my favorite and most used purchases this year.
customer_reviews.author: xxcjtxx

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful Buying It.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing seems to be wrong with my drive, so I'm not giving it a negative review. But make sure you have the right USB 3.1 port to use it. I don't and I can't find any adapter or hub that will allow me to use the drive, so now I have to sell it. I usually have great luck with the Seagate family but it's the cable confusion manufacturers are causing that's making me annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: GP Mckenzie

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, But Fails Backups Too Often
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it was Mac compatible "out of the box," unlike the other Seagate drives that say "Mac compatible," but are really formatted for windows computers. The good news is this drive is indeed Mac compatible right out of the box. The not so good news is the Mac automatic backups using Time Machine fail often. For this reason, I give 3 stars. If it can't reliably backup, it's a risky purchase. I've had a lot of problems with Seagate drives. They fail often and are very susceptible to power failers: even with surge suppressors. I bought this one because it was reasonably priced and had the storage I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D.

customer_reviews.title: After 3 months the unit failed. It still draws ...
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months the unit failed. It still draws power and works as a USB hub but the drive is no longer seen by any computer it's plugged into. Seagate charges $12 to ship a replacement under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Info small can not read. Complicated to install. Lots of menus to no where, not uselful. Force you to buy additional program and provide your credit card info for that program (a con). Amazon paid why do they want card info? Would not let me Finish since I would not give card info. Tried to install, can not tell if done or working. This was a horrible experience. My model not listed in help section, could not find. Seagate Refused to help, would not return my request for help. This was an extremely deceitful company and it's employees.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Seagate Backup Plus Hub 8TB External Desktop Hard Drive Storage around mid-July. I began backing up my data in August. Unfortunately, it is September 26, 2017 and my hard drive has stopped working and I am unable to retrieve any data from the drive. In addition, the hard drive just beeps. I have tried to connect it to several computers but to no avail. A big waste of my $$$ and the return date is now passed. Imagine that!
customer_reviews.author: Annice Y

customer_reviews.title: Using this as a backup for my computer.
customer_reviews.text: This is great I back up to my computer and when I am not using it I can store it in my safe. Small package and large storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: William Hartsock

customer_reviews.title: terrible support.
customer_reviews.text: unbelievably lack of support.... 4 hrs so far... will not accept the serial number on box and on the unit.... can't get an agent... all optional questions were irrelevant and resulted in return to menu..... had others check that I put in valid numbers.... no response from Seagate at all... terrible support... will try to return product ASAP
customer_reviews.author: dr bryan anthony mcclelland

customer_reviews.title: No power switch and hit or miss if it will connect to my computer.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has no power switch to turn it on/off so you have to unplug it either at the power source or unplug then re-plug the USB to you computer to get it to run. That is annoying but the main problem is that I had difficulty getting it to be recognized by my computer. (Winows ten) If I plugged it into a different USB port it might connect, then again it would not. So even though I could hear it running and the power light was on it was hit or miss to get my computer to see it. I gave up and am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Hub died after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: HUB after 9 months but drive was OK. Purchased two for redundant backups, one died after 9 months. Created RMA with Seagate but didn't want information on drive to be sent. Cracked open and pulled drive, erased with several passes and sent off. Drive was fine it was the hub / internal controller that died. Seagate sent a NIB after 7 business days. Probably should only lose one star but I'm still bitter after all the issues I have had with Seagate 3TB drives (Google it if you are unaware that these have a 90% failure rate and Seagate did nothing to support their customers)
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wrolson

customer_reviews.title: Something so small yet sooo loud :(
customer_reviews.text: Only had this unit long enough to share only a few things about it. It is attractive, sits on the shelve without fear of falling over, was simple to set up. I have in this short while not had time to use all it's features but one thing is for certain it is by it self the loudest device I have that is not suppose to generate all this racket! Man is it loud as if rodents are square dancing in the wall behind it. Can't wait to toss this disposable item and re install the old "HP" external backup.
customer_reviews.author: P Brassinga

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Backup Plus Hub for Mac Failed Within 5 Months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Seagate Backup Plus Hub to use with Tim Machine on my iMac in June 2018. About 5 months later, around the first of November 2018, the drive failed and will not load. Drive turns on and lights up but will not load. Disk Utility doesn't detect it either. Seagate technical support hasn't been very helpful. Their solution is to basically return the drive for warranty replacement. Thankfully this was a backup of my main drive so I didn't lose anything but this is EXTREMELY disappointing. I trusted Seagate hard drives for many years and will never purchase another Seagate after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: Very unreliable drive for any data of importance. Warranty exists but at consumer's inconvenience.
customer_reviews.text: Within 6 months, the drive is full of corrupted physical sectors making it unreliable and causing it to dismount in the middle of operations. The data stored on these drives is at risk and Seagate, though acknowledging a warranty, expects the consumer to return all of their products to them at the expense of the consumer. Amazon window for returns is likewise closed but a product should last at least 6 months or have a warning that it is not reliable for critical data back up.There are better, more reliable and more customer friendly options. I am now stuck with a faulty drive, lost data, and the cost out of pocket to get this exchanged directly through Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jason B. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Died a week after 2 year warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: This drive was fine up until literally a week after the 2-year warranty expired. I used it for time machine on my mac. Then it became corrupted. After trying multiple methods to recover, all data was unceremoniously lost. Thankfully, I had backed up on a RAID drive a while back. I'm going with Western Digital and their 5-year warranty next time.
customer_reviews.author: RLL

customer_reviews.title: Drive disconnects during data downloads
customer_reviews.text: This drive is noisy, vibrates through the table, disconnects constantly in the middle of photo image downloads, costing you much wasted time having to reconnect power, and then find where the file download left off only to start it over again. Avoid buying Seagate, they are prone to failing, causing you to lose data. Time is money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Longer term reliability
customer_reviews.text: I have four of the 8TB drives, and have been using them in windows storage spaces on a backup server. Three of the drives have failed within a year due to uncorrectable sectors. The failures have all occurred when the drives were over 90% utilized. I have a couple more 8TB archive drives (what's in these things) that I removed from the seagate external cases and put in fan-cooled JBOD enclosures. These drives haven't had any issues (yet) and have been running months longer than the failed drives. Warranty replacement is painful. The seagate website doesn't work for me when trying to create a return with my existing customer account. Returning as a guest works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it! Died after 4 months- NOT WORTH THE RISK!
customer_reviews.text: I love companies that sell you stuff and then give you a back-up guarantee because they know the product is not quality. Purchased this four moths ago and already dead. USB shut down, Drive stops mid backup and Data gone. Now I can send it to Seagate and have them "fix it" but wasn't the idea to have THIS as a backup and have the data available to me when I need it? 4 months? WORST PRODUCT FROM SEAGATE EVER! Not even worth the time to send it back to the,m- for what? The data is gone! Seagate, build a better product- it's that simple!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend buying another product besides this one
customer_reviews.text: I know you can get a dud sometimes but the experience i just had with a two month old drive and well over 8 hours of customer service leading to an eventual replacement is just not worth buying this drive even if it were priced at $10.00. Highly recommend buying another product besides this one.
customer_reviews.author: David white

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think of writing a review until today when I had ordered another 8tb external hard drive that was a different brand and I had something to compare to, this external hard drive has a very fast write speed I was getting 150 or so, the other cheaper 8tb external hard drive of another brand was much slower writing at 20 mb/sec... so if you are debating on buying something cheaper I would spend the extra $ 20.00 to get this one as it's much much faster, I will be buying another one to replace the cheaper slow one I made the mistake of purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: rpg

customer_reviews.title: 2nd died faster than the 1st... shame on me.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of this model i've tried. Both died fast. Just lasted long enough for the return window to close. I liked the idea of the extra usb ports but i lost a lot of data. Shouldn't have trusted seagate... I've had too many fail.
customer_reviews.author: christa elliston

customer_reviews.title: Been a MIS Tech person for over a Decade. This drive is awful.
customer_reviews.text: Had the initial one fail within 4 days. Replacement drive multiple issues so that I don't trust storing important media on it. AVOID THIS DRIVE AT ALL COSTS!!!!! The internal Barracuda drive is known for abnormally High failure rates after investigation. If I could return it I would but now I am stuck with it. Mac OS wont pick it up in EXFAT no matter what I do. On Windows 10 the connection to the drive continually Drops so that I cant even do a basic copy of over a half hour. Just an awful product all around.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Cole

customer_reviews.title: USB Cord Connection Problem
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this model based on the storage size and reviews. It is a fairly large drive, measuring 208 x 123.6 x 36 mm and the USB cord is only three feet (91.44 cm). I use this back-up unit with a laptop computer for storing my extensive library of professional photographs. The only issue I have with the unit is the cord stability. The connection to the unit is very shallow and the slightest movement dislodges the cord, dropping the computer connection. If I could improve this unit I would make the cord 4 to 6 feet long and create a locking mechanism that keeps the cord connected to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Kisler

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as promised, easy to install, and works like a charm with ample capacity.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised, easy to install, and works like a charm with ample capacity. I had to upgrade, as I have a couple extremely rare genetic diseases, and with that being said, I have ton of medical files I have to save over the years, and they are extensive. With 18 different doctors, and an extensive history, I can't take a chance of losing those files. The peace of mind having this stand alone backup, is worth its weight in gold to us. In addition, we have a very large photo file, so space to back everything up was why I chose this Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Salamon

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 10 days
customer_reviews.text: Upon initial install of the seagate management system, this unit crashed my entire machine day 1. Fortunately this was an expansion and I had time machine backups available. Now, the unit which has not moved from my desk will not initialize on either of my Macs. Processed return today. This was my lesson, fortunately I didn't lose any customer data.
customer_reviews.author: Christel

customer_reviews.title: This seagate back up is faulty.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new computer so I bought this 8T Seagate hard drive to save all my files to transfer them to my new computer. This hard drive keeps giving me an error message and doesn't work. Now I have to take it in to a repair shop to get fixed so I can use it. Apple tech support has been helping me and they cannot get it to work either. I am super irritated. I wouldn't buy it again. It didn't even work one time for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stiddy45

customer_reviews.title: died under a year
customer_reviews.text: copied data on it twice - under 2 TB each time six months apart then it sat in the safe unplugged less than a year old - i was planning on doing yearly backups - just clicks. does not turn on - support is ... well useless problem is even if i get a replacement - I no longer trust seagate as a backup for my stuff
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value at this price point and a solid warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value at this price point and a solid warranty term. I buy these in pairs to keep dupes of my data should one go out. Skip the data recovery, they have to void the warranty should they fail individually, to recover data. Use two for a cheap RAID set. and if one dies, swap it under warranty and sync them(Synctoy, Acronis, etc.) back when replaced. I've only had one double failure of drives happen in 25 years in IT. Turned out to be a power surge failed two drives in a week, before a replacement arrived. Stuff that was lost was mostly torrents. Quiet, small form, minimal power usage, expansive storage, great value, good warranty, etc. Can't fault them.
customer_reviews.author: C_Kritter

customer_reviews.title: dead after less than one year
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year after purchase, it appears to be dead. However, the hub still works. But it does not show up as a drive anywhere. And I am not sure what data is on it the one time I don't buy the protection.
customer_reviews.author: DziliziTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Value
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic alternative to paying for cloud storage service. The cost/value proposition at this point is hard to deny. 8 Terabytes for $150? That will only get you roughly 3 terabytes on Amazon drive and you have to pay every year for it. I bought two drives and set up one at a second location to create my own cloud and redundant mirrored backup in two locations using Resilio Sync and am more than happy.
customer_reviews.author: CB Adams

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm very happy with the drives
customer_reviews.text: Wanting to upgrade the (4) 2TB drives in my NAS, I searched for quite a bit for a inexpensive 8TB+ drive. Unfortunately bare drives just aren't affordable yet in large capacities. Instead I bought 4 of these guys and gutted the bare drives from them to replace my existing drives. Only 1 of the 4 were archive drives. The other 3 were Barracudas! ST8000DM004 to be exact. Overall I'm very happy with the drives, and my NAS is now 4x bigger than it was a few weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: bt

customer_reviews.title: 180 Mbs read and write on USB3.1 ASMedia motherboard chip in old AMD FX8370
customer_reviews.text: Drive performed as expected. 180 MBs read and write speeds. Can also read and write to Protable HDD attached to drive hub at full speed for that extra drive (80 MBs) concurrently while backing up at full speed to this HDD. Verified with Crystal Mark. Did a complete surface scan of approximately 66% of drive and it showed that it was perfect - absolutely no errors, so I'm certain that the whole drive is just fine. Good warehouse deal again, but the power adapter was defective and would cause the drive to fail and corrupt the data at times. I have plenty of extra 12v adapters and discarded the defective power adapter - so deducted one star.
customer_reviews.author: K Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Great drive but really slow write times.
customer_reviews.text: The harddrive seems to work fine but if you're transferring large sets of data from another drive be prepared to wait a while. The fastest write speed I saw was 23 MB/s. Which translated to it taking an entire day (including overnight) to copy my previous 1TB back up to this drive. Other than the abysmal slow write times, it seems to work pretty well. If you want a lot of space at a low price, this is the way to go but if you want a bit more speed/performance I'd recommend a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy customer and not interested in purchasing anything else from ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drive for right at 1 year. It has corrupted after installation and working for several months. Have contacted Seagate and they tell me that it will cost more than $600 to recover my data on their product that did not last one year. Not a happy customer and not interested in purchasing anything else from Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson Foster

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT count on this drive for a backup - or, actually, anything
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive has completely failed (checked on two computers) IN LESS THAN 60 DAYS! It is now past the automatic return period with Amazon, so I am dealing with the manufacturer. I hope to get a swift replacement, though my first choice would be to buy a different, more reliable, hard drive, now that I know better. (I'll update if I have any problems with Seagate.) Fortunately, the data on the drive was completely backed up, so I am not dealing with a loss of data; however if I was counting on THIS product to be my "backup" - I'd be in deep trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jaelyn Jensen, author of Creamy, Delicious, No-Drain Greek Yogurt, as well as Seth's Dilemma, Book 1 of Faith Triumphant, a Christian Romance Trilogy

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk; Followed Manufacturer Instructions, Still won't Initialize; Returning
customer_reviews.text: We are very computer capable here in our all-iMac office. We used to buy only Western Digital backup drives, but the recent horrible reviews everywhere scared me away. So, I bought this Seagate. It arrived yesterday to replace an older external drive that was dropped on the floor and surprise, stopped working. We followed the manufacturer's (simple) instructions to initialize the drive, but it wouldn't even recognize the volume. What has happened to quality control on external drives!!
customer_reviews.author: LLM

customer_reviews.title: failed on me
customer_reviews.text: Where does one find a good external bacup drive? This is the 2nd or 3rd (at least) Seagate backup drive that failed on me. This external backup drive lasted a couple of months or so, seemed to work fine, then just plain died. No power or whatever; meaning that when I plug it in the power light does not go on and my desktop computer does not recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bought four
customer_reviews.text: Three worked great, one over heated and quit within a couple of days time. The three remaining drives are still working after several weeks of hard continuous use. The fourth one is now cannibalized for its parts in other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Pantekoek

customer_reviews.title: Product is not reliable
customer_reviews.text: My Seagate backup plus 8TB stopped from working today with my invaluable data after nine months of rarely use. This product is not reliable and it can fail at any time, so if you are looking for a stable and firm product look for products from other vendors. My investment of more than $150 to backup of all my important data was lost in just one moment. I didn't try to apply the guarantee since it was shipped internationally and the cost to return it would be more than the full value of a brand new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY SEAGATE HARD DRIVES
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product from Amazon for $89 November 2018. Now March 2019, after using this HD 4 times, it is SMOKING. Seagate will retrieve the data off this useless piece of junk for $49 shipping fee and a $650 ESTIMATE to provide data, conditionally: "You will be charged US $49.00 for this order (local taxes apply). If the evaluation of your hard drive is successful and the Seagate team can recover your data, an additional US $650.00 (local taxes apply) will be automatically deducted using the card you've provided today. Standard UPS shipping rates might apply".
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box! I'm a PC user that just switched to MAC and I needed this. Simple to use and totally worth the money! I would buy again in a heartbeat. I've already used it to restore files I accidentally deleted - super easy!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Bound

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for a backup hard drive with USB 3.0 ports
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I took TheWireCutter's advice and bought this as a backup drive for my iMac, with a couple USB 3.0 ports as a bonus for connecting other drives. I partitioned into two 2GB volumes, one for Time Machine backups and one for SuperDuper copies. I liked it so much, I bought a second one for my MacBook Pro at work. (As others have mentioned, the "PC" and "Mac" versions of this drive are identical other than initial formatting and case color, so choose the color you want and reformat if necessary.)
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 Micro Type B - Weak Connector
customer_reviews.text: I've had a 4TB & a 6TB go bad... I've always praised Seagate Drives; losing faith in their product... The USB 3.0 Micro Type B Connector is a weak link for these drives... Constantly losing their connection... They should use the USB 3.0 Type B connector... A good connector is one that has a strong durable connector... If the "Micro Type B" is better than the then the regular "Type B" - then improve the Regular "Type B"... It's a much stronger and more secure than the "Micro" connector... Sadly it's probably cheaper to use the "Micro" connector...
customer_reviews.author: R. James

customer_reviews.title: Quite a bit slower than the WD competition
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a slightly more affordable alternative to a WD equivalent I purchased just before it. Needing another 6TB this was appealing. However, the Seagate has MUCH lower performance. The WD gets just over 90MB/s read and write. The Seagate, however, only gets about 50MB/s write and 60MB/s read. Same controller card, same system. Tested with both files and Blackmagic. The small file read/write is pretty abysmal. Further, its sleep is unpredictable. Start a large file restoration from the cloud and occasionally it's gone to sleep, forcing the entire process to start over again once I wake it. Would not buy again, but it'll do the job of serving as a backup to my backup.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hepworth

customer_reviews.title: Fast... doesn’t heat up... quiet....  I recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Just began using it... I daisy chain a 5TB Seagate so I can better transfer some of the older data to the new External, is really fast transfer speed when using USB 3.0 from laptop or tower. Is ughhh slowwwwww to do large files (video) on usb 2 Power cord should be triple the length... but maybe that is not ok engineering or electrically speaking. Also I’d suggest a 2 part cord so the transformer isn’t at the wal or on the power strip taking up 3 outlet spaces. Not knocking performance. The 5 TB Seagate I have has been used heavily for 2 years or more with issues... so I’m assuming this 8TB will perform equally if not better.
customer_reviews.author: James L

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to set up for use with TimeMachine my Mac desktop. I thought I would have to provide a USB cable, but it already comes with one. (It has a funny connector on one end that goes into the unit.) It just does its thing in the background. It appears to go to sleep when I turn off my Mac. My only concern is how long it will last. I've only had it for a little over a month now. I'll come back to update this review if it fails early.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: (Great product perfect price for the storage you get) VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: (I love it took a bit of messing with it at first to make it compatible with my Mac but well worth it since I’m able to use 99.9% of the storage capacity...if you get this I recommend doing a reset of the drive to free up those extra 100 or so gb) I've taken the time to update my review because after only using it for about a year it completely fried taking with it very precious and important pictures...note out of 8tb storage i had only used about 3tb I've had cheaper hard drives last me longer!!! don't buy unless you want to unexpectedly loose important files that are saved on it!!!
customer_reviews.author: jesus

customer_reviews.title: Its nice except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: This drive is nice is nice for its price now the only reason i give it 4 stars is because writing yo this thing is a complete pain its write speeds are so slow but if you dont mind waiting around to get any large files on to it and let them update as need it it's fine I had to move around 600gb to it and it took 10 hours but when reading off this it got 100+mps at all times making this good for music or videos even a game storage but when you first get it be ready to sit around for awhile
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Just a regular external hard drive, with added 2 port USB hub that only works if the two criteria are met: plugged in a power source and plugged to your computer or whatever device you'll use the extra space for. I also tried to connect this to 2 of the routers that I have so I can access it wirelessly but due to the router limitation (blocked by internet provider) it can not be configured. Not holding this against this particular product but at the same time, makes it useless since you can't access it wirelessly and it has to be plugged 100% of the time to both power and USB in order to work.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space and fast transfer to boot.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I am using for my photo backup. The unit is built very nice, comes with all the necessary software and connectors to get started. To get the optimum performance make sure to connect to a USB 3 or higher port. The front ports are excellent to have so you do not need to plug and unplug this to free up ports. Comes with 2 years warranty so I will have to see how long this lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Raquib

customer_reviews.title: Really liked this drive until...
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this drive (the look, the size, the usb ports ) until it failed on me and seagate is giving me the run around with replacing it even though I paid to have one shipped quickly (they said they shipped one but UPS says they didn't receive it or it's lost and seagate has to file the claim). I have a cloud backup of the 6gb of files that was on it thank goodness but can't continue to work on those files until I receive the replacement drive. So when it works it is a lovely drive but it's a pain when it fails and you are trying to get it replaced (within warranty).
customer_reviews.author: HouseofSanada

customer_reviews.title: Failed After only 5 Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drive five months ago and it failed. Said read/write error so I had to format it and scanned it for bad sectors seems OK now but never had a drive fail after only 5 months ,fortunately I have redundant drives I had 2 older 4 gb with all the same data. Shame on Seagate. Had to re-format hope keeps working this time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Koonts

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to the 1 Star reviews
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to serve as a backup for my wife's computer and as a secondary pictures archive. Luckily I have other backups because after one month of use, the drive started making a loud clicking noise and failed. It is no longer recognized on the computer. To make sure it wasn't just her computer I connected it to various other computers and none of them could see the drive. It has the only full backup of her computer and our backup of all of our kids photos. I went against my better judgement and tried Seagate for my data storage needs, next time I'll stick with Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: j.agu

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!! FlaGator
customer_reviews.text: These Tech companies are ripping people off! Seagate claims 10 TB... But, you only get 9.09 TB and their pre-loaded "stuff" is only 19.3 MB. So Seagate, what happened to the other .91 TB? An, yes I know all about the "Capacity Calculation Formal". But, not every Tom, Dick and Harriet know about this. When you advertise 10 you should get 10!!! So, beware customers! All these TECH companies do it. So, when tell you, you are purchasing a hard drive with "X" amount of storage space. You will be getting much less than that!
customer_reviews.author: FlaGator

customer_reviews.title: No problems for 16 months and ordering it again
customer_reviews.text: I noticed all the negative review and thought I would weigh in on some longer term experience. I bought an 8TB Hub Drive in July 2018. I have not had a single problem. It was easy to use from the start. I use mine primarily for backing up photos. I also love the hub connectors. These are really useful for attaching other drives or devices. These have worked flawlessly. The reason I visited this product now is that I am ordering another one!
customer_reviews.author: J cornish

customer_reviews.title: Case needs a redesign
customer_reviews.text: Saw the other criticism regarding this running hot. Checked it myself with my unit that only had a few hundred hours on it. At times would over 50 degrees C. Based upon what another review stated about improper ventilation, I'm running this without the case and it routinely in the 30's C even with heavy copying. The drive is great. The case needs a redesign
customer_reviews.author: Ardmeister

customer_reviews.title: Showed up once
customer_reviews.text: Finally did show up on desktop, but when I tried to open the "convenient" Mac - Start Here - it choked - would not go any further - then said it that I needed to eject it properly (I had done nothing) - now it will not show up on desktop OR Disc Utilities - restarted computer, is now "invisible" to computer - VERY unreliable
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Handy as heck.
customer_reviews.text: I leave this attached to my iMac as a backup unit. It wakes up as I need it. The added bonus is that because it's and iMac, it gives me access to USB ports without having to pull the mac forward, accidentally disconnecting some of the wires from the back .... iMac owners know the drill. This drive has 2 front ports conveniently located, well, in front. I didn't buy it for this reason but sure am glad I did. I'll be suggesting this to clients who have the same complaint about iMacs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: 8TB Backup Plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 8TB external backup plus. It is a little noisier than expected when backing up data or retrieving files from the drives. The transfer rate is pretty fast for an external drive. One reason could be because is new and the drive is still empty, so the data are stored at the OD of the disk. The OD data rate in a hard drive is the highest. So far no issues, but is always good idea to do a backup of a backup.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this In December of 2017, it will not turn on and I have many many family pictures on the device that I can no longer access meaning they are now lost forever I would NEVER buy a Seagate again I got it in December of 2017 and have used it maybe a dozen times this is garbage save yourself the heartache of losing your family pictures do not trust this device with your memories
customer_reviews.author: Rik

customer_reviews.title: Wish all my drives had built in USB hubs
customer_reviews.text: I can't say this Seagate Backup Plus is my fastest drive, albeit it is fast enough. However, it is a thoughtful design: reasonably attractive and has a built in USB 3 hub! I have 5 external drives connected to my Mac and am short on USB ports. Yes, I have an external USB hub but they can be flaky and draw power from the computer. During the past month, the USB hub of this Seagate has been rock solid for connecting other drives to: no dropped connections and fast. The hub is a simple idea but a great one. Wish all my drives had built in hubs.
customer_reviews.author: P.K. Frary

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have a ton of videos on my desktop so I was in need for a high capacity storage device. I know this Seagate is one of the best because I’ve read reviews on it. My only complaints are that it does make noticeable noice when it’s reading and writing. I have it in my desk and you can almost feel the desk vibrate when the disk is spinning. Also, mines seems to become really slow or even stop pasting something for a long period of time before starting again. I have a high end desktop so I know it’s not my desktop. Will be getting support from Seagate to see what is happening there
customer_reviews.author: RealizeGFX

customer_reviews.title: Really great backup drive
customer_reviews.text: I love this drive, I purchased it to surprise my mom by backing up ALL of the pictures and videos she has taken in the last decade or so (over 700,000 files) in one place. Then I was able to move the drive from my computer to hers easily and create a shortcut so she can access them all. I only used about 1/4 of it, so there is plenty of storage left and my mom was ecstatic! The two USB ports on the front are a nice bonus. I also own an 8TB Seagate external drive that I keep on my own computer, and it has performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage space. 2-port USB Hub helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of storage space for backup. Only problem is that every now and then, when copying large groups of files or large directories to the drive, the drive seems to spontaneously un-mount itself as a USB drive, interrupting any copying or downloading. But then pretty quickly the drive is re-discovered and re-mounts--not sure why this happens... I have one other of these backup drives and it does not behave this way. Doesn't happen all the time, only intermittently. None of my other USB drives have done this. (Is mostly an inconvenience, rather than a deal-breaker.) Otherwise, drive seems fine. The 2-port USB Hub included in the design is also helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great product, does what it’s designed to do, 1 problem.....
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great it does what it says, I’ve taken off stars because I should’ve used it as soon as it arrived but I didn’t, I trusted that a amazon product well, a simple one like this should have no problems, this one has a short in the electrical cord. If you can even get it on, AND to stay on; eventually the power will just go off. At first I thought it was the product, but I come to find out it was actually the power cord. NOW WHAT?? Another headache, another day.
customer_reviews.author: Just my thoughts....

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working about 2 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Seemed fine until my computer stopped seeing the drive. I've connected it to multiple computers now, some detect the device on the USB port, some don't. No computer is able to mount the drive. I'm planning to return it; but first I'm going to try and retrieve the 3TB of data I copied to it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a brief while, unlike my 6 terabyte & 8 terabyte Seagate 2 port drives!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for storage and also like the port features. It is working very well for me, as have my other Western Digital drives. Thank you! Temporarily, it worked well. Unfortunately, unlike my other Seagate drives (I have one with 6 terabytes and a later one with 8 terabytes)8,his one died unceremoniously on July 8th, less than six weeks after its May 21st delivery. Amazon is working on coordinating with Seagate on their one year warranty for me. Hopefully, they will provide a replacement that works!
customer_reviews.author: Constance Cumbey

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: So far I am extremely satisfied with this HD. Plugged it into my iMac and off it went working just as it should. No issues at all. Now it's not the fasted external but it's also not the slowest. I also really like the hub setup with the USB expansion. For 200 bucks this is a win for 8TB of backup! I needed something to store all my videos I make for YouTube and it has really helped keep all that off my SSD. Definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Kilcreations

customer_reviews.title: Great, and works nicely out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the same item, so when it arrived the first thing I did was try to chain it to the USB of my first drive. The new drive was recognized seconds after plugging it in on my Windows 10 device. Excellent working order out of the box. I have been using these drives to store and stream 1080p content for my network home theater system. The streaming works without buffering from the host computer, or from wired network devices. It is also usually flawless with wireless connected devices.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Really handy USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this drive. The USB 3 hub on the front is a lifesaver as I have a bunch of USB devices that are not permanently attached to my confuser. All of my USB3 ports are occupied on the machine itself and because of desk space issues the primary hub is inaccessible and actually full. Keep the drive front & center where I can easily attach my card reader or DVD writer when needed. The drive is fast and appears reliable. Just don't use the included dashboard as it eats a lot of RAM for no good reason. Have been running the drive for a few weeks now and it seems reliable.
customer_reviews.author: William A. FullerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great for an Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: The family was tired of constantly deleting games from our Xbox One and then having to download them again. This is the perfect solution to that problem. While Seagate makes a similar unit specifically marketed as for the Xbox One, this unit has the exact same specs. And instead of being in white like the specifically marketed one, it is black to match our Xbox One. This works perfectly for our Xbox One, and even powers up and down with it automatically to save energy. This is the PERFECT upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuyInBoston

customer_reviews.title: You can use it on a Mac and/or PC!
customer_reviews.text: I have three other identical drives for my old PC, but this one was formatted by my new 2018 Mac mini. I wanted this drive to serve as my backup drive using Time Machine, hence I used the HFS+ option. I will use SuperDuper! v3.2.4 to create a duplicate backup in case my internal drive crashes or becomes otherwise defective. I highly recommend the Seagate Backup Plus Hub for PC or the Mac. Moreover, the ecternal drive can be transparently used by both machines. I have found these drives easy to use, faultless, and extremely durable.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the capacity  2 Usb 3.0 hub is icing on the cake
customer_reviews.text: Got this in and immediately ran a test fir bad sectors and came back with zero errors so already off to a stellar start. I then run a read write test to see if speed is up to advertised rate. once again it got an excellent rating. Then i ran a test with another external drive hooked up to its usb 3.0 hub and once again my expectations were exceeded. SO far i have had this device for about a month and have been using it to store all my digital movies and shows and i have greatly enjoyed its performance. I have always loved Segate products and once again they have made me a highly satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for data hoarders.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent to store all your digital needs for you hoarders out there. I store most of pictures, movies and old games on here. My first hard drive was 4 GBs and I thought that was huge at the time, my how has times changed. Especially for the price, excellent! Plug and play use and has a useful hub for when I want to plug another USB device in and do not want to reach around the back of the PC. I use the hub to plug up another external hard drive for expandability and ease of transferring files. All in all, a fantastic value that will sure to keep your digital contents safe for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: The Toan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Good Until It Fails
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many external and internal hard drive, most of which have lasted for many years. This Seagate 4TB plus recently failed after only 2 years. Also, drives I’ve seen fail in the past usually failed gradually (I test my drives regularly), giving enough warning to repair and back up. This Seagate failed overnight, going from seemingly fine to being completely unreadable. My diagnostic tools reported that this was a hardware problem, and thus unfixable. Maybe this is an anomaly. I’m hoping I can get it replaced under warranty, assuming the warranty is long enough.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dennett

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Tech support was VERY helpful installing this. Easy to reach, responsive, and understood my questions from the start. It replaced about a 5-yr old Seagate I had (3TB) and I wasn't sure if I disconnected the old one that I'd still have access to it when the new one is in place. No problem. The tool kit on the newer model recognizes the old external hard drive so I can actually access either one now. The "Mirror" function on the new one is useful. Kind of a cross between manually moving files and auto updates.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Can't Copy and Paste Files
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tested it much, but I just wanted to use it to back up files and you're supposed to be able to copy and paste but it does not work.It starts like it's going to do it and then it speeds through the process and copies nothing. Tried reformatting the harddrive, but it didn't help. Planning on returning the product if I can't get it to work as that's the only thing I really wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quiet, cool
customer_reviews.text: Power saving features are a plus. wakes up quickly after hibernating. the external power supply means that it isn't drawing to many resources from your computer (in my case a surface pro 6) have been using it heavily for about 2 months now and i am satisfied with te performance. i cant wait to see how it handles after its got a few miles on it
customer_reviews.author: Taylornicole A Webb

customer_reviews.title: Works fine so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this drive for read access on a media server. In researching these drives, I had seen a lot of concerns about overheating due to the drive being in a tight enclosure with little airflow. While I could see this as a problem for warmer climates or non-air-conditioned spaces, my temperatures at idle are averaging 42C to 43C, not much warmer than my internal drives and I have yet to see it exceed 48C when writing files. I will update my review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Thanatos

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: The backup software that comes with this disk drive is almost impossible to figure out. When data is being written to the disk drive there is not a lamp that flashes showing you that it is busy. Technical help use to be good years ago but not anymore. Even my expensive Seagate disk drive (GoFlex Home) that I bought years ago doesn't work as it was originally intended because Seagate turned off it's capability that was the original reason for buying it in the first place. I can't trust Seagate anymore and won't purchase from them in the future. This product works as long as you have enough patience to figure out their backup software.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Fast, large storage, but so many issues with it "waking up".
customer_reviews.text: The USB 3 port on the back seems too loose. The cable comes loose all the time. I'm afraid I'll get data corruption because of this. Doesn't wake up very well, so when I try to open up ANY drive in Windows 10, I must wait quite a while before my drives can display. Sometimes I have to unplug this unit before Windows will boot, then plug it back in after.
customer_reviews.author: Lyonardo

customer_reviews.title: Bought 5 of them
customer_reviews.text: I like this drive so much I've bought 5 of them now. The built-in hub means you don't have to lose a USB port. However, I will caution you that you can overload the hub if you attempt to pull more amperage than it can handle. (Example: Plugging two USB powered 4TB hard drives might be a little too much.) Also, connecting this to a router to be used as a NAS drive works amazingly well. My router only has 2 USB ports, plugging 2 of these in means I can have up to 6 drives on my router!!! And, speed doesn't seem to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: D. B. WALTON

customer_reviews.title: Large Capacity
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for awhile on one of my desktops but the other PC doesn't recognize it. I guess that is how these things work. I would not know anything about write speeds or any technical stuff. I only use mine to store videos I make everyday. It is useful to charge devices and to upload from. I have read all the reviews and they don't look good but as for mine, so far no problems. I think I will buy another for the same purpose of storing videos on.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after less than 6 months. I bought this to back-up my data. Thank goodness my main drive hasn't failed since this one did while I was trying to back-up. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mo B

customer_reviews.title: USB port is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product. The drive is fine, but the USB port does a terrible job of holding a cable in place. Even the slightest bump of the cable, or even just the desk the enclosure is on, causes it to disconnect. I've tried multiple different USB cables to make sure it was the connector in this unit that was at fault and not the specific cable I was using. None made any difference. I ended up ripping the thing open and putting the drive in a cheaper but more reliable case. Haven't had an unexpected disconnect since.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Molloy

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, used two as RAID on iMac
customer_reviews.text: I dropped one of them on the floor and it failed. Did not try to get it replaced for free and I ordered a replacement. When the RAID is dismounted, MACOS does not automatically turns the power off, and the drives have no power off switch. So I plugged them to an extension cord with a switch. Being in an old house, the outlet has no ground and so it is a CFGI for safety. I noticed when I power the RAID off, my iMAC crashes, and restart automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Joan & Bernard P.

customer_reviews.title: X1 Yes, PS4 No
customer_reviews.text: I like it so much that I bought a second one for my newly-acquired PS4. Unfortunately, Sony is incompetent at listing peripheral requirements for the system they build, so this one is going back. It’s fast, silent, and huge, so buy away if you have anything aside from a PS4. If you do have a PS4, make sure to get an HDD without USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Orochi

customer_reviews.title: Had to reboot for the computer to detect this drive.
customer_reviews.text: Received this order on a timely basis but tried to hook it up today and it didn't work! Initially, when hooking up to the computer, it made a noise like it is hooking up, but then it didn't show up in my files and the light on the drive kept going out. Finally, in desperation I rebooted and it then detected the drive. The instructions should mention this. I hope this drive will work even if I unplug it and plug it back in.
customer_reviews.author: gmarcy

customer_reviews.title: It Requires a 110Volt Power Connection
customer_reviews.text: The pictures do not show it with other than a connection to the Mac. They do not show any power wires. Thus you cannot put it into a business bag and use it a a meeting or travel without carrying the external 110 volt power connection and extension cords to available outlets. It would be fine for just desktop use if there was an available unused power outlet or you have an unused outlet on your multi-port cord. Other than the Seasgate makes great reliable products that I use.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A

customer_reviews.title: Can't use all 8TB
customer_reviews.text: The side of the housing is printed "8TB". When the drive is mounted and opened in a folder viewer, it says "7.2 TB". I thought, okay, maybe it's just one of those powers of 2 conversion/simplification things that allows it to be called 8, instead of 7.2. But I have 5.1+ TB worth of files saved, and I can't seem to add anymore files. So I right-clicked to open the properties, and it said the drive has 5.1 TB of disk space to use, and 5.1 TB of disk space used. This is a far cry from the 8 TB I thought I was buying. Perhaps Western Digital (WD) might be a better choice for my future needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hall

customer_reviews.title: Solid external Drive
customer_reviews.text: Very very nice drive. I have this connected to my Apple time capsule so I can access it wirelessly from within​ my home wifi.
customer_reviews.author: John Benicy

customer_reviews.title: Dead already
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be dead already haven’t been able to back up since about a month or less after I used it the first time - bought in July - last back up August 11 or so
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Sussman

customer_reviews.title: Like the Seagate warrantty
customer_reviews.text: Built a RAID array and use this as a portable secondary backup. You can never have enough backups of you valuable data. It should be big enough to store my docs, pics and videos forever. I go not game otherwise I would want a bigger one but I do store a lot of computer images and they can take up alot of room. Hint, do not try to delete 40,000,000 pics from your RAID. It took me more than 5 days to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Reddevil_232

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for a year or 2 and it has worked fine. I wanted another for a redundant back-up. It works fine. It even survived a power outage while I was transferring files to it. The only thing is when I went to register the drive, as told to do when installing the drive, it said the serial # was not valid. It was the same on the box and the bottom of the drive. So I guess the warranty is pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.author: GGC

customer_reviews.title: It's fake HD
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this item in December 2019 & three months later stop working totally and when I contact Amazon I found that's I should return to mother company (Seagate) I found no cooperation or serious support from them although opened a three ticket no (10583338, 10583106, 10631597) the result totally ignored us from them, So I'm advising you to avoid this item or deal with this brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Uthman Ali
